com.mobius.vdrapi
Class LoginSecurityInfo

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.mobius.vdrapi.LoginSecurityInfo
public class LoginSecurityInfo
extends Object

A class implementing IHasFullLoginCredentials uses an object of this class to return the login credentials, security, and ticket information to any object that implements the INeedFullLoginCredentials interface. This class holds the following information:

  • The user ID to use when connecting to the document server.
  • The recipient ID as defined in the distribution database.
  • The password to use when connecting to the document server.
  • The security setting to apply to the session.
  • The security type to apply to the session.
  • The session ticket to be used. If this parameter is provided, it must be a byte array of length Types.MAX_SESSION_TICKET. The first time the session ticket is used, it must contain blank values. The returned ticket can then be reused on subsequent requests to open sessions for the same document server. Reusing tickets in this manner bypasses the authentication process.
  • The returned recipient ID that the ViewDirect document server assigns to the new session.

See Also:
IHasFullLoginCredentials, INeedFullLoginCredentials

LoginSecurityInfo

public LoginSecurityInfo(String userId,
                         String recipientId,
                         String password,
                         byte[] securityInfo,
                         int securityType,
                         byte[] sessionTicket)
Creates and initializes a LoginSecurityInfo object using the values passed as parameters to this method. If the session ticket that is passed in is null, this constructor creates a session ticket of length Types.MAX_SESSION_TICKET, and initializes it with blanks.

getSessionTicket

public byte[] getSessionTicket()
Returns the session ticket. The first time the session ticket is used, it must contain blanks. The returned ticket can then be reused on subsequent requests to open sessions for the same document server. Reusing tickets in this manner bypasses the authentication process. The session ticket must be a byte array of length Types.MAX_SESSION_TICKET.

public void setSessionTicket(byte[] sessionTicket)
Sets the session ticket. The first time the session ticket is used, it must contain blank values. The returned ticket can then be reused on subsequent requests to open sessions for the same document server. Reusing tickets in this manner causes the authentication process to be bypassed. The session ticket must be a byte array of length Types.MAX_SESSION_TICKET.
